subject: Music
title: Hip-Hop and Social Justice
description: A quick, practical guide to Hip-Hop and Social Justice.

hook.text: From the Bronx to Black Lives Matter, hip-hop has always been the soundtrack of protest.

buildup.text: Grandmaster Flash rapped about poverty. Public Enemy rapped about racism and policing.

discovery.text: Kendrick Lamar's Alright became an anthem at BLM protests across the country.

twist.text: Politicians who once condemned hip-hop now quote it in speeches and campaign playlists.

climax.text: Hip-hop gives marginalized voices a platform that reaches millions without permission.

punchline.text: The system never gave them a microphone. So they built their own.

quiz.question: Which Kendrick Lamar song became a Black Lives Matter anthem?
